reference.title: What Should Be Done When the Radiator Overheats?
reference.shortdesc: While occasional radiator overheating is normal under demanding conditions, persistent overheating requires investigation and remedy of underlying causes.

section.title: Normal Operating Conditions
section.p: Keep the following points in mind regarding normal operation:

ul.li: Maintain a full radiator water level at all times

Occasional boiling is normal during:
Driving through mud
Navigating deep sand
Climbing long hills in extremely warm weather
Engine efficiency is highest when water temperature is near boiling point

section.title: Addressing Persistent Overheating
section.p: When overheating occurs under ordinary conditions:

ol.li:
Investigate common causes:
Improper driving practices
Carbonized cylinders
Consider adjusting fan blade angles for increased suction
Consult the appropriate manual section for detailed troubleshooting

section.title: Adding Water to an Overheated Radiator
section.p: When adding water to an overheated radiator:

ul.li: It is safe to add cold water if the system is not completely empty
Important: If the water system is entirely empty, allow the motor to cool before adding cold water
